Node.definition: = action by which a relatively large number of people form a group in order to pursue a common goal together

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
literally: empty; hence: = state in which an event does not serve a useful purpose and is bound to fail
= action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
used in poetry only; = ruler of a nation or people
only found in poetry; = action by which humans discuss a particular course of action ► with the purpose of doing something that will negatively affect others
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a (non eschatological) ruler appointed by God and anointed with oil by a prophet or priest

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else
= piece of cord or chain; ◄ made by twisting together strands of palm fibres, linen, reeds, or gold; ► used for tying and keeping things together
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
literally: to laugh (at someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities express their lack of respect for (other) humans, often accompanied by laughter
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures
= referent pointing to a specific condition or circumstance

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= process by which deities experience extreme displeasure, ◄ described as an internal fire

= action by which humans, divine beings, or certain events cause (other) humans to experience a state of great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such as trembling and pain
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to pour our (a libation); hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to be appointed in a position of authority, usually accompanied by rituals including a libation
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= a pattern of behavior required by somebody in authority
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= process by which males among humans and animals generate offspring

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state of ownership of land, including any buildings and population centers located on it, or slaves

Node.gloss: ends of the earth > all people on earth
Node.definition: literally: ends of the earth; hence: = all people on earth, including those living in its remotest corners

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= causative action by which humans or deities cause individuals and nations to come to ruin in a violent way
literally: staff; hence: = state of authority over someone else symbolized by a scepter
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
literally: of a potter; hence: = pottery made of fired clay
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
literally: to be disciplined; hence: = action by which humans bring themselves to a position of submission before God, as a result of his disciplinary actions

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans experience fear
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= process by which the human body shakes, ◄ as a result of fear

= action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye
aramaism: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= process by which deities or humans experience an emotion of anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible, and almost exclusively used with God as the subject

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: to burn; hence: = process by which events such as evil and anger happen with intensity and with consequences, as if it were fire
= pertaining to being very likely to take place
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety
